questions.stem: What is the primary focus of structural editing?
questions.rationale: Structural editing focuses on the big picture: organization, flow, logic, and content development.

questions.stem: Order these editing levels from first to last:
questions.rationale: Editing proceeds from big picture to small details: structure → style → mechanics → final check.

questions.stem: Why should you edit in this specific order?
questions.rationale: Working from big picture to details is more efficient - no point fixing grammar in paragraphs you might delete.

questions.stem: What is the main goal of structural editing?
questions.rationale: Structural editing focuses on organization, logic, content development, and overall document structure.

questions.stem: What should you examine during structural editing? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Structural editing focuses on big-picture issues: organization, content, and logical flow.

questions.stem: During structural editing, don't worry about _____ errors at this stage.
questions.rationale: Focus on big-picture issues first; minor errors will be addressed in later editing stages.

questions.stem: What does stylistic editing focus on?
questions.rationale: Stylistic editing improves clarity, tone, word choice, and sentence structure.

questions.stem: Which shows improved style?

options.label: It is important to note that we will implement the system
Implementation of the system will occur
The system implementation will be undertaken

questions.rationale: Good stylistic editing eliminates unnecessary words and uses clear, direct language.

questions.stem: Click on the wordy phrase that should be simplified:
questions.text: Due to the fact that the meeting was cancelled
questions.rationale: 'Due to the fact that' should be simplified to 'because'.

questions.stem: Match wordy phrases with concise alternatives:

options.label: at this point in time → now
due to the fact that → because

questions.rationale: Stylistic editing eliminates unnecessary words and phrases.

questions.stem: What does copy editing address? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Copy editing handles grammar, spelling, punctuation, consistency, and formatting details.

questions.stem: Which is a copy editing concern?
questions.rationale: Copy editing focuses on mechanical correctness, including grammar rules like subject-verb agreement.

questions.stem: Copy editors should check _____ of style choices throughout the document.
questions.rationale: Consistency in style choices (capitalization, abbreviations, numbers) is a key copy editing responsibility.

questions.stem: When should proofreading occur?

options.label: After all other editing is complete

questions.rationale: Proofreading is the final step, after all content and style issues have been resolved.

questions.stem: What should you check during proofreading? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Proofreading catches final errors, formatting issues, and layout problems.

questions.stem: Which proofreading technique helps catch missing words?
questions.rationale: Reading aloud helps you catch missing words and awkward phrasing that your eyes might skip.

questions.stem: What does the symbol '^' mean in proofreading?
questions.rationale: The caret symbol (^) indicates where to insert text or punctuation.

questions.stem: Match proofreading symbols with their meanings:
questions.rationale: Standard proofreading symbols communicate specific editing instructions.

questions.stem: What does 'stet' mean?
questions.rationale: 'Stet' (Latin for 'let it stand') cancels a previous correction.

questions.stem: To indicate that two letters should switch positions, use the symbol _____.
questions.rationale: 'tr' (transpose) indicates that elements should switch positions.

questions.stem: Why are revision checklists useful?

options.label: They replace the need for careful reading
They ensure systematic coverage of all elements
They speed up the editing process
They eliminate the need for proofreading

questions.rationale: Checklists ensure you systematically check all important elements without missing anything.

questions.stem: What should be checked at the stylistic level? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Stylistic checks focus on tone, conciseness, and sentence structure.

questions.stem: What is the most important principle for effective revision?

options.label: Try to catch everything in one pass
Take breaks and get fresh perspective

questions.rationale: Good writing is rewriting. Fresh perspective from breaks or other readers catches more issues.

questions.stem: Remember that good writing is _____.
questions.rationale: The revision process is essential - good writing comes from rewriting and improving drafts.
